The pickup location for the offered item.
The net price of the product after tax

The sub category/material group of the product.

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: Description of all needed information to place a market place offer on the marketplace.
Stock Keeping Unit is an unique identifier of the dealer providing the product
The quantity value associated with the unit.
The unit of an item. Common units may be related to mass, count, linear, area, volume or misc.
The available quantity of an offered product.
The condition of the offered product.
The longitude of the 2D sphere coordinates.
The latitude of the 2D sphere coordinates.
The pickup location for the offered item.

The International Commercial Terms are standardized trade terms used in international commerce to define the responsibilities and obligations of buyers and sellers during the transportation and delivery of goods.
The absolute value of the price
The currency of the price.
The unit of measure (related to price)
The net price of the product after tax
The number of elements.
Elements in an array are accessed via their index. Indexing allows for direct access to any element in the array.
Images of the product.
Attachments, such as CAD drawings or certificates
If this is a single product or a lot of products (group) not being necessarly of the same part number.
The description of the product on the marketplace.
The brandname of the offered product.
The main category/material group of the product.
The sub category/material group of the product.
Category within the marketplace for classification of listings.
The original manufacturer of a product.
A link to either the product on the original marketplace/webshop or a link to the product specifications document.
The key of the key value pair
The value of the key value pair.
Further technical specifications.

Part ID as assigned by the manufacturer of the part. The Part ID identifies the part (as designed)in the manufacturer`s dataspace. The Part ID does not reference a specific instance of a part and thus should not be confused with the serial number.

Part ID as assigned by the manufacturer of the part. The Part ID identifies the part (as designed)in the customer`s dataspace. The Part ID does not reference a specific instance of a part and thus should not be confused with the serial number.
The description of the product within the marketplace that might differ from the digital twin.
Completeness of the product, e.g. missing parts are not acceptable.
Information on whether the product has been dismantled.
Information on mechanical damage to the part, e.g. two broken ribs or part deformation indicate mechanical damage.
Information on whether the product has corrosion.
Information on whether the product has been discoloured.
The availability date when the product is in stock.
The mileage the item was ins use.
Information on whether the product has been fired and suffered damage from heat.
Error codes that are recorded as part of onboard data and can be read as part of diagnostics
Unique identifier for a core
Description of vehicle where the EoL part has been dismantled from (if applicable)
Unique identifier of an item in a serial production
Tax percentage applicable to the product
The unit of a linear attribute.
The product height. According to: UCUM (Unified Code for Units of Measure).
Information, in which countries/areas the component has been in use
The product width. According to: UCUM (Unified Code for Units of Measure).
The product length. According to: UCUM (Unified Code for Units of Measure).
The product diameter. According to: UCUM (Unified Code for Units of Measure).
The unit of a mass related attribute.
The product weight.
Timestamp of the manufacturing date as the final step in production process (e.g. final quality check, ready-for-shipment event)
